topic.title: Application Names
topic.p: The app element marks the human-readable name of an application. It should not be used to mark the name of the command used to run an application; use cmd for this purpose instead.

section.title: Processing Expectations
section.p: Application names are usually nouns, and are often a common word or phrase that are indicative of their functionality. Frequently, they are simply the name of what the application is. In English and many other languages, the use of an application name in a sentence may sound like the author has simply mistakenly omitted an article if the application name is not understood to be a title.

For example, the calculator application that comes with GNOME is called Calculator. If an author were to write To start Calculator…, then a reader may confuse this for To start the calculator… with an error. This is even more pronounced in languages like German, where nouns are always capitalized.
For this reason, it is recommended that application names marked with the app element are rendered in italics are using some other font variation.
